subject: Cheating
Colleges and Universities
College Athletics
Football
lead_paragraph: Florida State will appeal part of an N.C.A.A. punishment that would strip the university of victories in 10 sports, including as many as 14 in football. T. K. Wetherell, the university president, called the penalty “excessive and inappropriate.” Bobby Bowden, the football coach, has 382 career victories — one fewer than Penn State’s Joe Paterno, the major college leader. Having 14 victories subtracted from Bowden’s total could ruin his chances of retiring as the N.C.A.A. leader. The university accepted the loss of scholarships in 10 sports and a four-year probation that the N.C.A.A. announced March 6 in response to an academic cheating scandal.
